DataElement.preferredName: Most Superior Computed Tomography Coordinate Aerated Lung Performed Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field for the highest coordinate used during a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis in which aerated lung is visible.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Most Superior Computed Tomography Coordinate Aerated Lung Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to highest coordinate used during a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis in which aerated lung is visible.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Greatest in amount, extent, or degree.:In anatomy indicating higher than a given reference point.:A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis. :A number or other designation that identifies a position relative to an axis or grid.

Concepts.definition: Greatest in amount, extent, or degree; constituting a majority.
In anatomy, indicating higher than a given reference point.
A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.
A number or other designation that identifies a position relative to an axis or grid.

Property.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border. SYN pulmo.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
